fields.summary: Ensure that adding inline im/mail server definition alters the warning message displayed on build notification page during build setup

fields.description:
In case a (scheduled) build fails to checkout/update the build fails.
Bamboo should retry the repository operations a few times before giving up and failing the build.
Scheduled builds are not at risk of repository failures and will not run until next scheduled.


Edit: This is actually more of an headache on Windows, where customers often have anti-virus or windows defender running. And sometimes a force clean build will fail, due to anti-virus locking the file.
fields.summary: Bamboo should retry Repository related operation before failing a build

fields.description: Agents took 50 minutes, once requested, to shut down. There were three threads available to shut down the agents and each waited 300 secs before shutting down the agent and moving on to the next one.
fields.summary: Each agent waits 300 secs before shutting down on manual request

fields.description:
When a build is in a quiet period and it is triggered manually in the meantime the action request is not handled and the dashboard is not updated.

To reproduce:

1) Create plan with a quiet period
2) Trigger build by SCM change
3) During the quiet period, trigger a manual build
4) The HTTP request will hang forever.

Here is a sample log.

2009-11-06 13:07:25,310 INFO [BAM::Events:pool-1-thread-5] [DefaultChangeDetectionManager] Found one change for plan 'SVN-SAND', waiting 1 minute to see if there are any more... (4 retries remaining)
..
2009-11-06 13:08:07,656 INFO [13851398@qtp-15427560-37] [AccessLogFilter] admin http://localhost:8085/bamboo/build/admin/triggerManualBuild.action?buildKey=SVN-SAND 46453kb

*??????????*

2009-11-06 13:08:25,317 INFO [BAM::Events:pool-1-thread-5] [ChangeDetectionListenerAction] Change detection found 1 changes
2009-11-06 13:08:25,322 INFO [13851398@qtp-15427560-37] [DefaultBuildExecutionManager] Change detection ignored. Plan is already be building : SVN-SAND
2009-11-06 13:08:25,322 DEBUG [13851398@qtp-15427560-37] [AccessLogFilter] END: admin http://localhost:8085/bamboo/build/admin/triggerManualBuild.action?buildKey=SVN-SAND 46453kb+5300kb 17666ms
..
2009-11-06 13:08:25,323 INFO [BAM::Events:pool-1-thread-10] [BuildQueueManagerImpl] Attempting to queue SVN-SAND with SVN-SAND-5.
fields.summary: triggerManualBuild.action is not handled when plan is in quiet period

fields.description:
Currently, only XMPP based messaging is supported. 
Would be great if AIM / MSN / Office Communicator could be added!
fields.summary: Add support for different IM protocols

fields.description: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Creating+a+Custom+Elastic+Image#CreatingaCustomElasticImage-5.3DeployingBambooontoyourInstance cannot be followed as mentioned directories and files are missing and steps are not explained correctly or are simply wrong and misleading
fields.summary: Documentation is outdated and wrong for http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Creating+a+Custom+Elastic+Image
webapp/atlassian-bamboo-agent-elastic-assembly-2.4.0.tar.gz is missing the artifacts needed to customise an ami

fields.description:
jira.bamboo.atlassian.com just hung.  Server was still up with *no* out of memory errors.  However when trying to access the web-interface, no response was received.  I took 2 thread dumps a couple of mins appart.

Restarted the server to fix the problem.
fields.summary: jira.bamboo.atlassian.com hung

fields.description: Some of our servers which our tests depend on, have scheduled periods of unavailability. When our tests run at these times it can cause problems (such as creating database locks) or cause tests to fail. It would be helpful if certain builders or queues could be scheduled to be unavailable on set schedules.
fields.summary: Ability to lock builders on a schedule

fields.description: The last step of the Create Plan wizard ('8. Configure Plan Permissions') doesn't have an 'Enable Plan' checkbox. It should have one, same as the other pages of the wizard.
fields.summary: Last step of create plan wizard doesn't have an 'Enable Plan' checkbox

fields.description:
The buttons on the Edit Plan wizard are inconsistent between tabs. Every tab except for the 'Requirements', 'Artifacts' and 'Notifications' tabs use the '*Save*' button to save changes, however those three use the '*Done*' button.

I gather that this was deliberately done as each of those pages have a form that items get added ('saved') to. However, I still think that renaming the 'Done' buttons to 'Save' can be done without confusing the user.
fields.summary: Buttons on Edit Plan wizard are inconsistent

fields.description:
AUI 2.0 has changes that are not currently compatible with Bamboo's js, especially the restrictions they have imposed where the selector $ is no longer allowed

This is needed for 2009-11 Upgrade Pack.
fields.summary: Upgrade to AUI 2.0.3

fields.description:
The scaling on the build result summary chart can mislead the user.

The chart displays relative build durations and not absolute ones.

If all builds take pretty much the same time (say 1h +/- 1m) and one off takes 10m less this may lead users to assume that something is wrong.
fields.summary: build result summary (build duration) chart scale is misleading
Delete stage deletes always first one
Artifact url decode is limited to utf8

fields.description: Basically the same issue as FE-871 -- Bamboo adds all users that are "visible" through Crowd, and Crowd is exposing every user, not just the users in the allowed group.  We have ~4000 users in the directory and ~30 that are setup to be visible to Bamboo.  After integrating Bamboo with Crowd, Bamboo added all 4000 users.  It should only add users that are authorized to use Bamboo.
fields.summary: Integration with Crowd explodes user count

fields.description: When building from a branch (using subversion) it is sometimes helpful to know the 'last changed revision' in addition to the revision that is the head of the repository.  This could be displayed on the build summary page right underneath the 'Revision'
fields.summary: Build Summary screen should show 'last changed revision'
Allow input of some SVN URL to the pom and credentials.
Ensure the new builder/jdk is selected when returning to the page.
Update doco
User can create plans from pom.xml
Bamboo can parse the pom.xml plan details
Resolve concurrent chains issue with hack
User can specify a pom.xml for plans to be created from
update page inline rather than reload after adding builder/jdk/mail/im
Make mail server template more compact
inline builder/jdk needs extra message about adding to server capabilities
Update administration - builders and jdks to support 100 agents
Update administration - agents matrix to support 100 agents
Update administration - agents page to support 100 remote agents.
Update requirements page to support scaling to 100 agents in compatible lists and or tooltips
Update live activity page for a plan to scale when many agents can build the plan.
Discard view agents acreen

fields.description:
Acceptance criteria:

* 100 remote agents can concurrently connect to one server.
* The 100 remote agents include both remote and elastic agents.
* 100 builds can concurrently run
fields.summary: Spike backend support up to 100 remote agents

fields.description: Update repository descriptor documentation for change detection ftls
fields.summary: Update repository descriptor documentation for change detection ftls

fields.description:
I can't enable scheduled backups on a vanilla Bamboo 2.4 install, when I go to save the configuration I get the following error,
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.core.cron.generator.CronExpressionGenerator.getCronExpressionFromInput(CronExpressionGenerator.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.admin.migration.Backup.doSave(Backup.java:113)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
{code}
fields.summary: Can't enable scheduled backups

fields.description:
We have a LCD monitor dedicated to a fullscreen bamboo telemetry screen.
Every night when the backup occurs, Bamboo changes the screen the backup-in-progress screen.
When the backup has completed, the backup screen remains. This is a nuisance because we then have to manually switch back to the telemetry screen every morning.

I think it would be useful if the backup was stateful in the sense that it knows what screen was being displayed at the time the backup started, and returned to that screen once the backup completes. It could poll the backup progress at predefined intervals to determine whether or not to return to the previous screen.
fields.summary: Bamboo backup-in-progress notification page should automatically refresh and revert to previous page when backup is complete

fields.summary: After builk action "set web repository" some additional data is appended to Build Definition XML
Concurrent builds should be enabled by default only for chains and should be optional for normal plans
existing live execution page for build should show summary or latest concurrent build
each concurrent build should have its own live results page
Existing live page should show summary of running chains or redirect if only one is running
Each chain execution should have its own live page

fields.description: Bamboo doesn't deploy on Weblogic 10.x
fields.summary: Make Bamboo compatible with Weblogic 10.x

fields.description:
The styles for the hover popup seem to have gone a bit haywire. They need some padding and the borders and fonts look a little bit funny.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Build hover popup styles broken in 2.5-m2 on BEAC

fields.description:
The chosen update interval is not displayed correctly when re-editing gadget properties.
I.e you choose 15 min as interval and save. On next edit 'never' is displayed. If another property is edited and the interval is not checked the user may accidentally save 'never' as the update interval.
fields.summary: Bamboo gadget update interval is not persisted when re-editing

fields.description:
Just a proposal for 2-liner
Date buildCompletedDate = getBuildCompletedDate()
return buildCompletedDate != null && DateUtils.isSameDay(buildCompletedDate, new Date())

Created from Crucible comment by Marek Went: https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-BAM-656#c13933
fields.summary:
Just a proposal for 2-liner
Date buildCompletedDate = getBuildCompletedDate()
return buildCompletedD...
Please export BuildDefinitionConverter so that plugins can have it injected.

fields.description: I can't use the BDAC dashboard any more because it locks up Firefox and eventually crashes it. It immediately shoots to 1.4GB of memory and maxes out one of my four cpus.
fields.summary: Bamboo 2.4 dashboard is unusable in FF 3.5 on Windows XP

fields.description:
As a bamboo administrator
I want to describe a build plan
so that others may understand the purpose of a build plan

- This could be implemented by allowing administrators to leave comments on build plans
fields.summary: Comments on Build Plans
problem commenting on build using jabber interface

fields.summary: Block size error when creating a project

fields.description:
The file/version/diff links on the Commit page have empty {{href=""}} attributes.
Clicking on those links just loads the current page again (i.e. there is no attached javascript).
fields.summary: all SCM links on Commit page are broken (empty)

fields.description:
The summary tab of a plan shows a useful chart called "Build Duration per Build"
This chart often confuses me because the y-axis, time, starts at the minimum time recorded, rather than zero.  While I can see that this allows more detail to be shown on the chart, it can be very misleading if you don't look at the axis.  I often see it and think a build has taken 10 times as long as normal, when in fact it's just a couple of extra minutes because the graph starts at an hour.
fields.summary: Make the axis on the build duration per build graph start at 0

fields.description:
the bamboo wrapper log in <bamboo-install>/logs is not of a rolling file appender as is the atlassian-bamboo.log in <bamboo-install>

If bamboo is run as a service (bamboo.sh start) this log can get infinitely large.
fields.summary: Bamboo wrapper log in <install>/logs/bamboo.log is not rolled
UI issues with new style dropdowns

fields.description:
If tests produce artifacts with file names that are non UTF-8 or whatever the jvm is started as these files cannot be deleted.

examples:

langgreek_\354\341\344\345.pdf
langlatin1_\276\265\305.pdf
legacy_\200m\374he.pdf
legacy_m\374he.pdf

bamboo errors with 
19-Oct-2009 22:55:26 Cleaning build directory '/home/rjs/bamboo-home/src/PDF8-DAYLINUXX86/pdflib'
19-Oct-2009 22:55:26 Unable to clean source directory '/home/rjs/bamboo-home/src/PDF8-DAYLINUXX86/pdflib' File does not exist: /home/rjs/bamboo-home/src/PDF8-DAYLINUXX86/pdflib/intern/ats/pdflib/results/general/filename/langgreek_����.pdf

Artifacts are created as
de_DE.ISO-8859-1
gr_GR.ISO-8859-7
de_DE.UTF-8.
fields.summary: Cannot delete files with different file name encoding. Bamboo should handle all possible system encodings for file names

fields.description: If a dependency already exists that the user created and If maven decides it also wants this dependency it should overwrite the user created dependency (set editable = false) otherwise the user can still remove this dependency themselves later.
fields.summary: Automatic dependencies shall override user dependencies
Use Maven's internal API to determine whether an artifact is a snapshot version.
Add a link on the "Live Activity Logs" page to the (in progress) .log file

fields.description: Move BuildDefinition persistance from BuildManager to BuildDefinitionManager
fields.summary: Move BuildDefinition persistance from BuildManager to BuildDefinitionManager
Subversion CVS p4 to use new module descriptor
Splitting descriptor into two
Updating the builder to build with the new -f flag
Update the maven builder plugin which does the pom parsing
Add the UI

fields.description:
if the dependent plan is triggered and actively building AND the parent executes again, it does not add a new instance of the dependent plan to the build queue. It looks like bamboo sees the dependent plan is already running based on the prior parent invocation so it does not need to be added to the build queue again.

Have 2 agents.
To reproduce create a plan (P)arent with a short build time and (D)ependant with long build time. 
Trigger P-n and wait till D-n is triggered by P-n. Then commit to repository which will trigger P-n+1. P-n+1 does not queue D-n+1.
fields.summary: parent build does not trigger dependent plan if dependent plan is busy at the time when parent checks for dependencies.
Automatically turn on build blocking when turning on maven dependencies with warning
Build blocking for chain dependencies
Redirect to last result of the chain if no chains currently running
Clicking the run page should go to the live results page.
Speed up feedback for when a chain is started
View a build that didn't run because of a failed prior stage in the chain

fields.description:
Remembering which tab you're on for configuraiton
Tooltips broken
Styling for tabs for build configuration
Dropdown build menu is too narrow.
Build Configuration tabs no longer check if there is data not saved before navigating away from the tab.
fields.summary: Miscellaneous UI ugliness

fields.description:
When defining the bamboo mail server via a JNDI resources leads to a class loading problem:

h3. with !-- <Set name="parentLoaderPriority">true</Set> --> in jetty.xml:webapp
{panel} 
ERROR [14738709@qtp-4439869-0] [SMTPMailServerImpl] Mail server at location [mail/BambooMailServer] is not of required type javax.mail.Session, or is in different classloader. It is of type 'javax.mail.Session' in classloader 'sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader@92e78c' instead
{panel}

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Setting+up+JNDI+on+Jetty recommends to enable parent class loading only in case class loading problems are experienced.

h3. with <Set name="parentLoaderPriority">true</Set> in jetty.xml
{panel}
2009-10-19 17:10:31,551 ERROR [11012842@qtp-8077566-0] [FiveOhOh] 500 Exception was thrown.
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
...
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/activation/DataSource
	at alt.javax.mail.internet.MimeMessageImpl.<init>(MimeMessageImpl.java:22)
	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:171)

{panel}
fields.summary: class loading problem when using jndi mail resources.
Give option to isolate local maven repository per agent
create a build by simply providing a pom.xml location and goal
Spiking read pom before build occurs using maven 3 embedder - svn only
Allow user to specify location of pom file

fields.description: Bamboo is dead. Long live Bamboo.
fields.summary: Bamboo deadlock on RemoteElasticInstance
Provide persistence to abstract "artifacts/particles" consumed and produced by plan.

fields.description:
Bamboo 2.4 running from its default image which has Elastic Agent 2.4 inside hangs 2 out of 10 times on agent <-> main server communication. What's weird it's not listed on instance list! (https://bamboo.openx.org/admin/elastic/manageElasticInstances.action) The only way I was able to find it was Amazon's console.

The only message in agent's logs is:

{noformat}
0 [main] INFO com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.client.ElasticAgentBootstrap  - Using tunnnelling. Registering 'httpt' and 'httpst' protocols.
1321 [com.sun.sungrid.service.tunnel.server.TunnelServer] INFO com.sun.sungrid.service.tunnel.server.TunnelServer  - Waiting for tunnel connection.
{noformat}

The Agent (Java process) is working, and so is the monitor in cron, but the instance is not shut down in this scenario and if not finally found (via Bamboo's UI) - it would had to be paid for, but not used.
fields.summary: Elastic agent hangs waiting for first communication with main Bamboo server

fields.description:
"Powered by a free Atlassian Bamboo open source license for com.atlassian.extras.core.DefaultProductLicense$DefaultOrganisation@4f3c89. Try Bamboo - The Zen of Continuous Integration"

this happened since Bamboo 2.4
fields.summary: DefaultProductLicense and DefaultOrganisation instead of proper values in Powered by line

fields.description:
When an agent's capability is referenced in the builder's goals (for example the Maven2 builder) or the System environments, or pretty much any places that accepts el expressions, this should add an implicit requirement to the build plan.

This closes the loop where a agent specific capability is required for successful builds, eg. BAM-4710, but not enforced as a plan requirement.
fields.summary: References to bamboo.capability.* in the builder screen should trigger an implicit requirement for that capability.

fields.description:
the TriggerRemoteBuild  checks that the ip address of the source repository matches the IP adress of the build trigger.

The architecture of GitHub.com has changed since they moved from the http://www.engineyard.com/ to rackspace.  The ip address is no longer the same as the repository (in fact it changes with each commit -have seen dozens of different ip addresses)

Would be nice if we could use an  optional shared token to authenticate for cases where we can't use the ip address.

It would be nice if the trigger was a plug-in that we could tailor for each repository environment.
fields.summary: allow shared token authentication of TriggerRemoteBuild
Provide layer of abstraction to generate dependencies based on "artifacts" consumed and produced by plans.

fields.description:
A customer has requested that the Bamboo/Clover plugin track coverage per-committer.

This could work as follows:
* a build is triggered by a commit
* bamboo builds, and a clover.xml is produced
* a post build plugin (possibly part of the clover plugin?) could extract who changed which source file from the SCM
* the plugin then queries the clover.xml for the coverage of each file and records that number against the committer
* a report is generated that shows each committer's %coverage

There are some problems with this, for example:
* how to handle multiple committers of the same file in any particular build
* if committer X modifies file F, but committer Y modifies test T that covers X - committer X is attributed with the coverage for X (clover per-test coverage could help here)
fields.summary: Report coverage by committer

fields.description:
viewing dependencies for a plan does not translate the dep type from it's i18n key

{panel}
 Dependencies
Dependency Blocking Strategy: *build.dependency.strategy.buildParentIfHasChanges*
When a parent plan successfully builds, it will trigger the current plan to build.

    * JUnit - Simple JUnit

{panel}
fields.summary: i18n problem in dependency view screen

fields.description: We don't save the Build Number to file until after the setup completes.  If you stop bamboo during the setup process.  When it restarts it thinks you are on version "0" and tries to run upgrade tasks.  Unfortunately for Oracle, PreBootstrapUpgradeTask706OracleMSSQLFix will completely fail and wont let Bamboo start up (I imagine this is a problem for MSSQL as well.)
fields.summary: Restarting Bamboo After Oracle DB configured and before setup complete fails

fields.description:
since bamboo 2.4 the jboss endorsed library is rejected by bamboo.
jboss cannot be booted when removing the endorsed xercesImpl.jar in jboss
fields.summary: Bamboo 2.4 not compatible with jboss 4.2.x offending jar xercesImplxxx.jar

fields.description: after installing bamboo using the 2.5 M2 windows installer bamboo does not start because bamboo.home is not set.  I checked bamboo-init.properties and it has not been updated at all.  See install4j logs
fields.summary: Installer not setting bamboo home

fields.description: Need to see more than 100 lines of currently executing build. Would like to see the entire log, it should be one of the options on that screen.
fields.summary: Ability to see entire log for running build
Drag & drop for build queue reordering
Implement a MD5 hash routine.

fields.description:
Bamboo 2.4 is still using the 1.0 version of the soap api for JIRA.
This client does not include the new JQL methods for JIRA (e.g. getIssuesFromJqlSearch)
fields.summary: Update JIRA Soap Client
PHPUnit builder has problem with Clover integration while run on remote agent
PHPUnit builder has problems with collecting test results while working subdirectory specified.

fields.description:
This is an issue to track the require updates to the plugin documentation in Bamboo.

1.) Add a page similar to the JIRA doc on "Differences between Plugins1 and Plugins2"
=> (andrew) (/) Blatantly plagiarise http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Differences+between+Plugins1+and+Plugins2
_Draft:_ http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Bamboo/Differences+between+Plugins1+and+Plugins2

2.) Identify which plugin module types are Plugins 1 and which are Plugins 2. 
=> (andrew/brydie) (/) Add a new column on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Plugin+Module+Types to display this information.
_Draft:_ http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Plugin+Module+Types
=> (andrew) (!) Add notes to each of the module type pages to identify whether a module type is Plugins 1 or Plugins 2

3.) Add the missing servlet plugin module types from the plugin framework to the Bamboo docs:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/PLUGINFRAMEWORK22/Plugin+Module+Types
=> (andrew) (!) As above.
_Drafts:_
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Servlet+Context+Listener+Plugin+Module
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Servlet+Context+Parameter+Plugin+Module
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Servlet+Filter+Plugin+Module
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Servlet+Plugin+Module

4.) Update http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Web+Section+Module and http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Web+Item+Module to include content from the equivalent module type pages in the pluginframework docs, (but retaining any Bamboo specific info)
fields.summary: Improve the Plugins documentation in Bamboo
